articles.headline: One by One, ISIS Social Media Experts Are Killed as Result of F.B.I. Program
articles.snippet: American officials say a secretive campaign of surveillance and drone attacks has cut the Islamic State’s ability to inspire attacks in the West.
articles.abstract: American officials say a secretive campaign of surveillance and drone attacks has cut the Islamic State’s ability to inspire attacks in the West.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the summer of 2015, armed American drones over eastern Syria stalked Junaid Hussain, an influential hacker and recruiter for the Islamic State.
articles.byline: By Adam Goldman and Eric Schmitt

articles.headline: Dull Car Finish Now Shines
articles.snippet: A flat matte finish is gaining popularity, with car enthusiasts willing to pay as much as thousands more for a vehicle with the dull look.
articles.abstract: A flat matte finish is gaining popularity, with car enthusiasts willing to pay as much as thousands more for a vehicle with the dull look.
articles.lead_paragraph: For most people, nothing is quite like buying a brand-new, shiny vehicle. Unless, that is, it’s a brand-new dull one.

articles.headline: Consumer Protection Bureau Chief Braces for a Reckoning
articles.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is in the cross-hairs of Republicans who contend that it — and its director — have too much power.
articles.abstract: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau is in the cross-hairs of Republicans who contend that it — and its director — have too much power.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Mild-mannered, lawyerly and with a genius for trivia, Richard Cordray is not the sort of guy you picture at the center of Washington’s bitter partisan wars over regulation and consumer safeguards.

articles.headline: Republicans Divided Between Romney and Giuliani for Secretary of State
articles.snippet: The leading candidates are both high-profile politicians with their share of detractors.
articles.abstract: The leading candidates are both high-profile politicians with their share of detractors.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Rival factions of Republicans are locked in an increasingly caustic and public battle to influence President-elect Donald J. Trump’s choice for secretary of state, leaving a prominent hole in an otherwise quickly formed national security team that is unlikely to be filled until next week at the earliest.
articles.byline: By Jeremy W. Peters and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: Where Marijuana Plants Flourish Under Energy-Saving LED Lights
articles.snippet: An electric company in Washington is offering incentives to cannabis growers to upgrade their operations — a high-stakes experiment in energy conservation.
articles.abstract: An electric company in Washington is offering incentives to cannabis growers to upgrade their operations — a high-stakes experiment in energy conservation.
articles.lead_paragraph: TUMWATER, Wash. — Behind the covered windows of a nondescript two-story building near the Olympia Regional Airport, hundreds of marijuana plants were flowering recently in the purple haze of 40 LED lights.

articles.headline: Hungry Venezuelans Flee in Boats to Escape Economic Collapse
articles.snippet: Well over 150,000 people have fled Venezuela in the last year alone, the most in more than a decade, scholars say, with the sea route posing special dangers.
articles.abstract: Well over 150,000 people have fled Venezuela in the last year alone, the most in more than a decade, scholars say, with the sea route posing special dangers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WILLEMSTAD, Curaçao — The dark outlines of land had just come into view when the smuggler forced everyone into the sea.

articles.headline: ‘My Soul Feels Taller’: A Whistle-Blower’s $20 Million Vindication
articles.snippet: A jury sided with Patricia Williams, whose suit against Wyndham Vacation Ownership described time-share sales tactics that were particularly harmful to older buyers.
articles.abstract: A jury sided with Patricia Williams, whose suit against Wyndham Vacation Ownership described time-share sales tactics that were particularly harmful to older buyers.
articles.lead_paragraph: Patricia Williams, 44, is a single mother of two grown children, as well as a grandmother. She is also a rarity: a whistle-blower who has succeeded in bringing to light abuses at a powerful corporation that wanted to keep them hidden.
